sn8.4:1.1: At one time Venerable Ānanda was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn8.4:1.2: Then Venerable Ānanda robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Sāvatthī for alms with Venerable Vaṅgīsa as his second monk.
sn8.4:1.3: And at that time Venerable Vaṅgīsa became dissatisfied, as lust infected his mind.
sn8.4:1.4: Then he addressed Ānanda in verse:
sn8.4:2.1: “I’ve got a burning desire for pleasure;
sn8.4:2.4: tell me how to quench the flames.”
sn8.4:3.2: because of a perversion of perception.
sn8.4:3.3: Turn away from the feature of things
sn8.4:4.1: See all conditioned phenomena as other,
sn8.4:4.3: Extinguish the great fire of lust,
sn8.4:4.4: don’t burn up again and again.
sn8.4:5.2: meditate on the ugly aspects of the body.
sn8.4:5.3: With mindfulness immersed in the body,
sn8.4:6.2: give up the underlying tendency to conceit;
